page.title: 06BERGERAC
page.content: For the last few years there has been a B.B.C. television drama series, set in Jersey, called Bergerac. It features Jim Bergerac, a fictional police detective catching the criminals who break the sometimes special local laws. It was of great interest to the islanders because they could recognize places used as film sets such as the beaches and castles. Bergerac is watched all over the U.K. and has been sold to many other countries bringing Jersey world wide fame. The local people knew that some things were changed for the programme, roads led to the wrong place and some names were changed. The Old Court House, a very popular local pub in our D block was renamed The Royal Barge in the T.V. series. Noirmont Manor, also in our block, was used as the home of another of the T.V. characters.
